mods.note: ■% V I Re: Electric Svipplj in ray Residence I -understand that a complaint has been made that I have installed 10 additional- light points in my house. This is not correct. The facts are as follows:- The house has a permanent installation of 4 light points, one,in each of the three large rooms, (two on the first landing and one on the 2nd floor), and one in the varandah. In addition to this an extra shoe is fitted in each of the three rooms which gives the house ordinarily altogether 7 light points for use. Although i have fitted up extra connections in the two varan- dahs flanking my bed-room on the 2nd floor, and another on the stair-case leading to it, these extra connections are so fitted up with separate plugs for each am that only one point at a time can be used on the shoe available in ray bed-room. From one of the two rooms downstairs one of the shoes in used for an extension of 4 lights on the ground floor, one in the kitchen and one in each of the three small rooms which are occasionally used. From the above it will be observed that I am using three extra light points than what is allowed with the permanent fittings in the house. I have occupied the house since November last and I have been using the same points as indicated above through-out the 7 months of ray resi dence. Furthermore, I would like to mention that ray current bills will testify to the fact that my consumption has been kept down to the minimum. My highest bill for any one month has been under Rs.10/-. The fusing of the main switch at 10 a.m. on the 30th May, cannot be attributed to overloading in ray house. In fact ray lights and fans were not in use at the time the incident occurred. I shall be glad if ys an inspection could be arranged in order that I may be cleared of the charge of overloading, and the current restored as early as possible. physicalDescription.extent: The file is arranged in chronological order from the front to the rear of the file.

Foliation: the main foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 40; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file consists of correspondence relating to electric lighting in Manama, Bahrain. The papers cover the requirements for extension of the power network, appointments within the state Electricity Department, and notice of service closures. The correspondence is between the Political Agency in Bahrain, Adviser to the Government of Bahrain (Charles Dalrymple Belgrave), State Engineer (Hubert Poyntz-Gaynor Leigh), and some customers and employees of the Electricity Department.Folios 18-19 are internal office notes.
